name: mathopd-webserver
location: sbin/httpd: Multiple $Id strings showing file versions from 2003-2007

name: uClibc-library
description: uClibc C library identified through dynamic linker reference. Exact version not specified but referenced as ld-uClibc.so.0.
notes: It is recommended to conduct further investigation to determine the exact uClibc version for a comprehensive vulnerability assessment.

name: GCC-compiler
description: GCC compiler versions 3.3.2 and 4.5.3 identified through compiler identification strings. Indicates mixed build environment or toolchain updates during development.
notes: Older compiler versions may introduce vulnerabilities due to outdated optimizations or lack of security features.

name: openssl-crypto
description: OpenSSL version 1.0.2h identified with multiple critical vulnerabilities including CVE-2016-2177 (CVSS 9.8), CVE-2016-2176 (CVSS 8.2), and others.
notes: Critical vulnerability exists. It is recommended to immediately upgrade to OpenSSL 1.0.2u or later.

name: busybox-utilities
description: BusyBox version 1.14.1 is identified through the version string in its binary file. No specific CVE vulnerabilities have been found for this version, but due to its age, it may contain unpatched security risks.

name: minidlna-media-server
location: usr/bin/minidlna: Multiple version strings in binary output
description: MiniDLNA version 1.0.24 identified with no known CVEs. Includes dependencies like SQLite (version unknown), FFmpeg libraries (53/51), libexif (12), and others with some potential vulnerabilities.
code_snippet: Multiple version strings in binary output
notes: SQLite vulnerabilities may be present but exact version unknown. Recommend obtaining exact versions of all dependencies.

name: openssl-library
location: lib/libssl.so: strings output with build timestamp '3 May 2016'
description: OpenSSL version 1.0.2h identified in libssl.so with same vulnerabilities as openssl binary (CVE-2016-2177, CVE-2016-2176, etc.).
code_snippet:
SSLv3 part of OpenSSL 1.0.2h  3 May 2016
TLSv1 part of OpenSSL 1.0.2h  3 May 2016
notes: Same critical vulnerabilities as openssl binary. Upgrade to OpenSSL 1.0.2u or later recommended.
